snippet: A study on reducing blood pressure ended suddenly because medical ethics demand that researchers stop giving inferior treatment to any participants.
abstract: Q&A answers readers' questions about achieving and maintaining low blood pressure after government study found overwhelming evidence low blood pressure reduces risk of heart attacks and strokes.
lead_paragraph: A study on reducing blood pressure ended suddenly because medical ethics demand that researchers stop giving inferior treatment to any participants.

headline.main: What a Compelling Blood Pressure Finding Means for Patients
headline.print_headline: What a Compelling Finding Means for Patients
